mean_cn: n.妥协，折中；  v.使遭受危险
mean_en: an agreement made between two people or groups in which each side gives up some of the things they want so that both sides are happy at the end
sentence: The seller made a compromise and sold the dress at 50 yuan.
sentence_trans: 卖方做出了妥协，以50元的价格卖出了那条裙子。
word_etyma: com共同 + pro前面 + mise送，放出 → 共同承诺、遵守一项决定 → 妥协，和解
